title: PLEASE HELP, suggestion for a script face
content:
I am looking for a very womanish/feminine, but readable script, any suggestion?

thanks a lot

 [‹ Pair for Dear Sarah?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080119125313/http:/typophile.com/node/18783 "Go to previous forum topic") [MIRC font used for the first x-men movie credits ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080119125313/http:/typophile.com/node/18764 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Wei Heng

comments.content: I can’t help suggesting Bello from Underware. Just bought it for a project of mine and it makes me happy as hell (sorry for the harsh expresion). Best script in many years. I just wish I had designed it myself ;-)

Wendy is adorable. And Bello makes me that happy too, Stefan. :^)

What is the project? There are sooooo many great script typefaces out there. It might be easier if we knew how it was to be used.

[Amadeo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080119125313/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=C.108905.0.0) — [Avalon](http://web.archive.org/web/20080119125313/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FB.113529.0.0) — [Bickley Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20080119125313/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=C.2563.0.0) — [Suave Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20080119125313/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000165) — [Artscript](http://web.archive.org/web/20080119125313/http:/www.p22.com/lanston/products/artscript.html) — [Corinthia](http://web.archive.org/web/20080119125313/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/corinthia.html) — [Petemoss](http://web.archive.org/web/20080119125313/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/petemoss.html)
I like Dalliance Script from Emigre
